result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Michael Makuski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $200 plus cost including the DNA surcharge. To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission - DNA required

Defendant Brandon Michael Makuski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:59 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  GUILTY

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Pay fine of $200 plus costs including the DNA Surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Provide DNA sample.
Plea hearing on July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 7, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:54 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter is before the Court for a plea and sentencing hearing.

Atty McFarland does not know where his client is.

State requests a warrant with $500 cash alternative.

Atty McFarland believes cash alternative is appropriate.

Court addresses the Court, reviews the file.
Notice was sent to Defendant as well as stated in Court at last hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant failed to appear.
Court will order a bench warrant for arrest, $500 cash alternative.
Plea hearing on May 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Michael Makuski in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he has contacted some attorney's, but cannot afford them.  

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court on the defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
